questions.question_text: An engineer wants to verify the access control lists that are applied on interface gigabitethernet0/0. Which command provides the desired output?

discussion.content: sorry, 192.168.1.x or 192.168.2.x range of ip. with this placement they are able to communicate

Within subnet mask 255.255.252.0 the range IP is from 192.168.0.1 to 192.168.3.255, so switch A thinks the entire range IP 192.168.2.x is its own IP. C is correct. the subnet mask must be fixed to 255.255.255.0

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. PC A is able to ping its gateway but is unable to access resources in VLAN 200. Which statement describes the root cause?
//IMG//

choices.C: The subnet mask for interface VLAN 300 does not match the subnet mask for PC A.
choices.B: An ACL is needed on Switch A Gi0/1 to allow traffic to pass.
choices.A: Interface VLAN 300 needs also to be configured on Switch B.
choices.D: There needs to be a port channel between Switch A and Switch B to communicate properly.

choices.B: A packet with a source address of 2001:DB8:AD59:ACC0:2020:882:DB8:1125 will be denied.
choices.C: HTTPS traffic from the 2001:DB8:AD59:BA21::/64 subnet will automatically be permitted along with HTTP traffic.
choices.A: The denied entries will be logged because of the explicit deny ipv6 any any log line.
choices.D: A packet with a source address of 2001:DB80:AD59:BA21:101:CAB:64:38 destined to port 80 will be permitted.

discussion.content: A) The denied entries will be logged because of the explicit deny ipv6 any any log line. âˆš
it's A. DB8 is different of DB80
its A. It says destined to port 80, not destined to a host using port 80

A 
The question ask about restrict telnet session, even the telnet is not allow on this configuration. But session-limit command is the correct answer

choices.C: Apply the access-class 175 in command on line con 0.
choices.A: Apply the session-limit command to the VTY lines.
choices.D: Remove all configured usernames other than the admin account. A
choices.B: Add the aaa authorization command to the global configuration.

questions.question_text: Which protocol does mGRE use to determine where packets are sent?

discussion.content:
It is important to note that mGRE interfaces do not have a tunnel destination. Because mGRE tunnels do not have a tunnel destination defined, they cannot be used alone. NHRP fills this gap by telling mGRE where to send the packets.

references: http://www.firewall.cx/cisco-technical-knowledgebase/cisco-services-tech/896-cisco-dmvpn-intro.html

comments.content:
Yes. That is quotation from the link:
"NHRP is required on mGRE tunnel interfaces because it provides the VPN-layer-IP to NBMA-layer-IP address mappings for forwarding IP data packets over the mGRE tunnel."

discussion.content:
i should real answer "CEF" ... again, very interesting ...

 Cisco Express Forwarding Fast Switching for mGRE

Currently, traffic in an mGRE interface is process-switched, resulting in poor performance. The DMVPN solution adds Cisco Express Forwarding switching for the mGRE traffic, resulting in much better performance. There are no configuration commands necessary to turn on this feature. If Cisco Express Forwarding switching is allowed on the GRE tunnel interface and the outgoing/incoming physical interfaces, then the multipoint GRE tunnel packets will be Cisco Express Forwarding-switched.
